data.name: REIT Basics
data.text: Real Estate Investment Trusts (REITs) allow investors to earn a share of rental income from real estate without having to own or manage properties. They also often offer high dividend yields.

questions.text: What advantage do REITs offer compared to buying and managing properties directly?
What is one benefit of investing in REITs?

data.name: Types of REITs
data.text: REITs can be classified as equity, mortgage, or hybrid REITs. Equity REITs own and manage physical properties, while mortgage REITs invest in mortgages and other real estate loans.

questions.text: What is the difference between equity and mortgage REITs?

answers.text: Equity REITs own properties, while mortgage REITs invest in loans
Equity REITs invest in loans, while mortgage REITs own properties
Equity REITs and mortgage REITs are the same thing
A REIT that invests in both properties and loans
A REIT that invests only in properties
A REIT that invests only in loans

questions.text: Which type of REIT invests primarily in mortgages and other real estate loans?
